subject: [junit] Catogery based filtering support in Junit/ JunitEXT
msgSnippet: Hi I want to I want to call a Junit but execute the methods that are annotated with @P1 only. The following is the junit //JUNIT TESTCASE public class
messageBody:
Hi

I want to I want to call a Junit but execute the methods that are annotated
with @P1 only. The following is the junit

//JUNIT TESTCASE

public class DummyClass {

@...
@P1
public void t1()
{
System.out.println("Method is t1");
}

@...
@P2
public void t2()
{
System.out.println("Method is t2");
}

}

Please let me know if this possible with Junit or JunitExt. If possible what
are the steps to acheive it.

Also my assumption is we have to first declare an annotation type for each
@P1, @p2

Please let me know if the following is how to do it, especially if
@Target(ElementType.METHOD) part is correct

How do i call this test, with ant or commandline, so that only those
methods annoated with @p1 get called



@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
@Target(ElementType.METHOD)
public @interface P1 {

String value();
}

Thanks
Sharath


--
